attributes.content: An old monster once told me... What doesn’t kill you only makes you stronger.
I always thought it was stupid. But the guy’s a monster, so maybe I do have to give this some thought.
Does a bug jump into a flame to get stronger? So stupid.
No. Let’s not talk about how dumb and weak a bug is. You know, no matter how strong a bug gets, in the end, it’s still just a bug.
If a bug jumps into a flame, all it proves is that the heat messed up its brain. Assuming it even had a brain, it obviously went mad.
But what if I was to leap into the flames? Besides proving that I’m crazy, what else would that prove? I’d come out a bit charred, but how would that make me any stronger?
But we’re talking about death here. And what does an undying monster know about death?
Alas, such is the nature of the bitter death that none may resist.
You’ll still talk to me? That’s a surprise.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I thought you were totally caught up in your plan to destroy Lungmen, Talulah.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W. You haven’t given anyone notice of your visit.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hah. Oops, my bad. I’ve been a mercenary for too long, forgot all about that reporting-every-detail-of-my-life-to-the-boss thing. Sorry, Leader.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But you know I can’t go all the way up to the top of the command tower, so I have to ask you to stoop to my level.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Your sarcasm isn’t doing us any good, W. Reunion needs the might of the Sarkaz, and we should strive not to add any more personal conflicts between us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Just call us devils. Only the bleeding hearts and self-righteous call us Sarkaz. Us mercenaries? We know exactly what we are.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Strange. Devils, the 'inferior race of the banished.' You mercenaries cannot accept this definition, nor will you take pride in it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Duh. But your people started calling us 'devils,' not as a hate thing, or because it was catchy or whatever.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Devil is a 'fear' thing. You people called us that because we scare you.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: So us mercs like being called 'devils,' because we know exactly what it really means.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: And we always make good and sure anyone left alive takes the subtext straight to heart.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Oh, sorry— Me yapping on about this is like trying to show off in front of an expert, isn’t it?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: We’re a no-name merc squad famous for brutality. But compared to you? Why, that’s like a worm trying to go up against a crab.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: After all, Leader, nobody scares people better than you.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: 'Inflict terror upon your enemies, and provide warmth for your friends.'
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: To strike fear into our enemies and bring hope to our comrades. That is the way Reunion has always done things.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So, driving Ursus’s core city into Lungmen is also in line with a certain comrade’s ardent wish?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Our warriors are still bravely fighting inside Lungmen. They need our assistance, and we will bring it to them.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The Infected inside Lungmen require hope, and our warriors here have expressed their earnest desire to be that source of hope.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Everyone’s wishes find harmony here, and the responsibility to see those wishes come to fruition belongs to us, Reunion.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: —This will also bring benefits to the Sarkaz. I assure you, beyond doubt.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What your kind seeks is not hope, so I will provide you with profit.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Sarkaz mercenaries like you, scattered between various city states, as well as those who pull your strings. You will drink deeply of the chaos between cities and countries, and it will nourish you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: After Lungmen, no nomadic city is safe. Your kind will find more room to expand and thrive, and your people will prosper.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ooh, sounds like a good deal. Just going off the profits, I’m totally on board.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Tell me, W, what doubts do you still have?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: None. You’ve made a great case. Want a standing ovation?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then let’s talk about my mission. Bad news is I failed. I didn’t manage to bring back my target, and she wouldn’t give me the thing.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: That is not your fault. The kinship between Misha and Skullshatterer was bound to lead to uncertainties.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why’d you send me to grab that scientist’s daughter then?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It seems like you didn’t even need her or her secrets for your big plan. Between the attack on Lungmen and firing up the core city, what was the point of her anyway?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The authenticity of the key still has to be verified.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I can personally verify that we’ve activated the core city, but Reunion still needs full control over the way it stops. That’s where this key comes in.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Mephisto told me the one the old geezer found in the abandoned city was the real deal.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: No, W. Mephisto would not tell you that. It would only be you spilling secrets to Mephisto while thinking about extracting the information you want from him.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So, is that bit of news true or not?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You’re not interested in hearing my justifications, but you also don’t plan on offering yours either.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I have my own channels, and might be a little more frank than I used to be. Oh, but I guess I could’ve mixed up my sources? Something like that.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W, if you want me to be more transparent, I can explain to you the details of my plan. All of them.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Skullshatterer and your first operation tested the L.G.D.’s response speed. It allowed us to adjust our strategy and improve upon our plans to take down Lungmen.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Without your cooperation, we could not succeed.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The Key did truly exist, but was lost upon Misha’s death. The Key that Patriot sought was only a backup plan to deal with this situation.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I won’t force you to tell me where your information came from, but my explanation should convince you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: All right, all right. But, Leader, I want to know how many Keys there are. Won’t ask any more questions after that, yeah?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Two. Sergei, Royal Chernobog scientist, held one of them, and delivered it to Misha using special means.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The other was held by Count Boris, former mayor of Chernobog. During our attack, he broke off a city plate to flee. However, he was unable to escape the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The ruined satellite city.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Our undercover agents in the city have kept everything there that we need. We can lure the L.G.D. into an ambush given the proper distance.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We have sufficient reason to capture the abandoned city, and the best use of it is to occupy it and turn it into a stronghold.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You’re really good at explaining things, Leader. I’m all out of questions.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Hey, I’m not asking too many, am I? Sorry to make you waste so much time explaining it all to me.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W, if openness can resolve the misunderstanding between us, I won’t be stingy with my time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: In order to ensure a relationship of long-term mutual benefit, I will continue to draw up our future plans. Hopefully this can slightly increase the trust between us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We will need to support each other to have a chance at overcoming the troubles to come.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Really? I’m touched.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I never liked this woman.
The Talulah they talk so nice about in private is so insanely boring. And this Talulah talking to me right now is just another lying bastard.
Oh, not to say there’s anything wrong with lying.
I lie a lot. Nothing stronger than a well-placed lie, except maybe a bomb. The truth is like a cup of water. What good does it do when the whole house is on fire?
But when I lie, I know I’m lying. I chew up my thoughts up and spit them into ears. This she-dragon, though, she lies so natural it’s like the words come out of someone else’s mouth.
Doesn’t matter who she’s talking to. It’s not just tweaking a couple points to cover up her plans.
—She takes on a totally differently form, turning into something they trust more, telling them what they want to hear.
Reunion’s most beloved figure is, of course, the Leader, Talulah. Standing here with me, she’s a businesswoman, a trader. With Patriot she turns right into a warrior woman.
She’ll show her true face one day, but not everyone will live long enough to see it.
Besides, does she even... have a true face?
Is she an onion? You keep peeling off layer after layer until you realize there’s nothing inside?
I mean it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: She was acting honest as an Iberian nun just a minute ago.
She lifts her hand slightly. Hah, I know that trick.
Right now she’s like a cunning Savra after a lifetime of raiding and killing.
Something pulls away the air in front of me, and in a split second it’ll melt away my whole body.
Don’t tell me you’re ready to kill me after a little bit of teasing.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Nobody has ever figured out the formless things Talulah throws around— but I know exactly what they do.
Ruins. Debris. Things lose even their most basic structure.
It’s just like a fire without light.
I am her prey.
I should have known.
Kinda obvious, dragon lady. The old Talulah wouldn’t have showed her cards this early.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Waiting to die, or plopping down some long-winded monologue before the end, just isn’t my style.
I never thought about dying. At least, not now.
The small device I tossed out moments earlier while I was talking, falls to the ground and blooms into a ball of flame before me.
A wave of heat rushes towards me. Luckily, the comforting warmth isn’t hers.
I’m no Arts expert, in my experience, ninety-nine percent of Arts are no match for this pure burst of energy.
Explosions. Heat, shrapnel, shockwaves. It’s an equalizing force that tears apart any enemy, or me.
I just need to draw out the stalemate a little longer. Until all the seeds I planted finish blooming.
You’re such a hard worker, Talulah. You even went through all that trouble to play out a sitcom with me. I knew it, you really would make a great actor.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This dragon lady... I don’t really hate her that much, do I?
Those who don’t know how to deceive cannot tell lies, and thus are not liars. And she... is a monster soaked in lies.
She doesn’t need to lie.
No wonder I get kinda... Okay, I admit it, kinda scared when I see her. I don’t hate her, but I might really be afraid of her.
And fear breeds caution. If you’ve got your guard up, you’re prepared.
Your little tricks are actually able to neutralize my Originium Arts. I might have underestimated you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hey, this 'little trick' took me hours to put together. Show some respect, huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But if a little bit of your fire was all it took to make me roll over and die, what kind of devil would follow me?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You came prepared. You planned to attack me from the very beginning.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You made the first move, dragon lady. Are you trying to torch me because I’m a pain, or do you wanna shut me up because I’ve seen through you?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: To punctuate my sentence, a wave of heat surges from her fingertips and leaps towards me. Man, this dragon bitch just won’t let me have any fun.
I bend my waist and drop into an exaggerated roll, making it look like I’m tying my shoes.
Uh-oh.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Aim better next time.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W, your dirty tricks have been exposed. You are now an enemy of Reunion.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why do you oppose me? This is certainly of no benefit to you?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why? Why do you think this was my idea? I sure as hell didn’t want us clawing at each other’s faces this soon.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Fact of the matter is, you attacked me first. Hmm, trying for a little shock and awe, huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I guess I have no choice then. I just have to kill you before you kill me.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Your insanity has deepened your blind confidence.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Lying to me is no big deal. I don’t really care who you lie to, how many people you kill, or how many people you lie to...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But, dragon lady, you’ll regret lifting a finger against me.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Am I the kind of person who says stuff like this?
Maybe I really am losing it. Can’t even call this insanity at this point. Seems more sentimental than anything else.
I guess I really fucked up.
I see. Pretending to be crazed and stupid had us all fooled. Turns out, I misunderstood your character this whole time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So considerate of others. What a lovely little devil you are, such a colorful character.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ahaha... *spits*.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Not as lovely as you, of course. But, you’ll be even cuter once I rip your tongue out. Can’t have it lolling around.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Do you think your little traps are enough to kill me?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Did I ever mention that I set a trap?
Better watch your feet. Might be a trap. Say, how many do you want?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: How many do you have?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You pitiful thing. My flames have found you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You will pay for your betrayal.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Woah... Creepy. What’s the matter with you? Who are you talking to with that tone of voice?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I know you hate these words, W. You also hate me for pointing out your purpose.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Uhh, well, thanks for being so considerate of my preferences. You think you can rile me up with the right phrasing?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: And like, my purpose? How many people you plan to kill has nothing to do with me, dragon lady.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What do you know about me? You’ve got like eighty different plots within plots going on in that noggin and you’re gonna guess what’s in mine?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W... You want to prevent me from using the core city to attack Lungmen.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If you simply wanted revenge, you would not have chosen this moment. If you wanted to kill me, W, you could have waited until both Lungmen and I are incapacitated. That would have been the wise move.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Trying to talk me into giving you information was another cover. A mercenary leader who cares nothing for the direction of Reunion would not ask me, the 'Leader of Reunion,' about my plans.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You know, I won’t kill you— as long as you put aside your interest in this war. Do that, and I’ll spare your life.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I’m fond of you, W. You’re good comic relief. And I have no desire to execute a harmless harlequin.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: However... a madwoman who will use any methods available to kill me has no right to judge good and evil, let alone claim to understand my plans.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Are you really as violent and insane as the performances you put on suggest, W?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Would you shut up already—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You are not.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You want to stop Reunion. You want to stop the attack on Lungmen. Those are your intentions.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: W, W... You’re all too easy to read. I didn’t even need to make any plans to investigate you. You came here wearing your heart on your sleeves.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That’s a load of bullshit.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I’ll turn you into a puddle of gore and have someone dump you down the waste chute, assuming there’s anything left.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I press the button on the device in my hand. A simple Originium detonator switch, remotely operated, chained explosions.

A blazing light of destruction mixing with a deliriously pungent aroma. Waves of heat carrying fragments of debris, overturning everything in front of me. Just as I planned, everything reduced to cinders, even the most thick-skinned Sarkaz...
Wait...
Wait, wait... Didn’t I have a detonator mechanism for the explosives?
Why did she plant her sword in the ground?
Was this your trap?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Try me, W of the Sarkaz. Try again.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hold on, you...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: No fire. No burning.
The hundreds of Originium explosives I painstakingly twisted into the steel foundations of the city... are all gone.
Where are the explosions? The heat? The shrapnel?
Nothing.
The place where I planted the Originium is deformed, melted, and warped. Drips of iron and the burned oil paint covering it gives off nasty smell. But that’s it.
My shrapnel. My blast waves. My light show. It’s not going to happen.
The cataclysm that I pictured in my mind a million times over... isn’t going to happen.
The cunning dragon lady must have poured her Arts into her sword and channeled it deep into the steel beneath us.
The heat radiated to each of my traps, melting them away.
You figured it out. You’re so smart, W.
The world-ending explosion from all directions that should have blown her into a billion little pieces... is nothing but a big, wet fart.
All right, I’ve been thoroughly played.
*Cough,* *cough...*
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Dragon lady, you’re... not half bad...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Was this result also part of your plans?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Let me guess, your backup plan is, you’ll show me an improvised suicide bombing spectacle, isn’t that right?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Let’s not waste each others’ time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Don’t get too cocky... *cough*, *cough*... little girl. Say, are you... even the same person? Right now, even I... don’t really wanna know.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I don’t need you to define me.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Choose your death. Die by my flames, be thrown from the city walls, or be run through by my sword.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Can you really... finish me off?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Steel must endure a thousand trials in the forge before it can become a sword. A sword is destined from birth to be a weapon.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But you... are just a mortal shell that has not yet died.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Ah, that... would be an honor.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: To be impaled by this sword... Would I be... the first one?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Unfortunately, you’ll have to accept second.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Now... If we’re talking people I’ve blown up... You, well...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...wouldn’t even have a number.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Am I going to die? I guess so.
But what’s so bad about death? There are many things worse than dying.
So, when you feel like you’re done for...
As long as you’ve prepared for the stuff worse than death, you’ll even manage to surprise yourself.
Now... I think, it’s about time I also blow this joint.
*cough*...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You blew yourself apart right in my hands...? I thought you’d be more afraid to die.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Though your defection didn’t surprise me, you, yourself, did... surprise me a little.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You had some potential... as the opening act of a farce.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I hope your death was painful enough, W of Victoria.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: After the battle, 31 hours until impact, 6:30 PM
Leader.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Sir. Your return gives me great peace of mind.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Formalities, unnecessary. There was a battle here. Just now.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: It was between me and W, who tried to assassinate me. Don’t worry, I’m fine.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: From the reports I’ve received, she was already showing signs of rebellion when she occupied Chernobog.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: She made her own decision to let the enemy escape, instigated the Sarkaz mercenaries’ rebellion, and murdered her superior.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: These series of actions were likely caused by outside political forces.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Where is she now?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: She should have, stood trial.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: She detonated the explosives hidden around her body and fell into the core area.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I will dispatch someone to search for her body. Sir, you need not worry yourself.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That, does not concern me.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: And her Sarkaz? What of them?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I will deal with it. Now that the core city is steadily moving on track, I’ll need to stabilize the situation immediately.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Leader. This core city... was activated. Without my knowing. Why?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Even the comms. Have been broken.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: We’re out of options. Ursus may attack Chernobog at any time and slaughter our compatriots. For their sake, we must first take down Lungmen.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Right now, all energy must be used to support the operation of the core city, and we have no excess power to support tuning the ingoing and outgoing channels.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The Originium left behind by the Catastrophe is so potent that we cannot endure it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The order to recall you exhausted the last of our backup supply. Now, there is only one place that can provide us with enough refined Originium.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Even then, if time is tight. Please discuss with us.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: What you say may be correct. I’m sorry, Sir. I should have given it more thought.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But... What’s done, is done.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: This Key. How will you use it?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: It can stop the city.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: This city... can be stopped?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Many things, once started. Will not stop.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: So, I’m entrusting this key to you. You’ll decide when we stop.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I apologize for giving you such an arbitrary command.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You seem more subdued today than usual, Sir.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No. I will go. To guard the core city.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Someone will attack. They will try.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: And I will stop them.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Excuse me, Sir.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Crownslayer, FrostNova, Mephisto, and Faust are still waiting for our help. We must not let any outsiders interfere with our plans.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Talulah.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: What’s the matter, my champion?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Leader.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Any evil, no matter how great. Will always come, to an end.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: This, I firmly believe.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Yes, I share the same conviction.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Goodbye, Leader.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Go, Patriot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: To end this war and regain the status of the Infected, Reunion will crush all enemies standing in our way.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What’s this?
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: A kind of, Sarkaz talisman. Two pieces.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: This one, is for you. The other one, I will keep.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: What are these for? It’s a bit heavy.
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: They can, keep you safe.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: You still believe in those weird Sarkaz things? ...What’s the point of this?
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: Let me finish.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: This talisman. Can withstand torture.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: Mortal wounds, destroyed organs, no. But the consumption of life, it can withstand.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: Until it breaks.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: If yours breaks... Mine will tremble.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: And I will go. Save you.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: What if both pieces break?
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: ...Why aren’t you saying anything?
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: Uh... Fine, I’ll hang onto it.
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Hoarse Voice

attributes.content: I’m obviously going to outlive you, so you just do your own thing.
attributes.name: Chilling Voice

attributes.content: Help, who? End, what war?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: My talisman. It, too, has broken.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: You killed W.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: What are you going to do now?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Liberate you. You will no longer need to bow before a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: All that you desire, I shall grant you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And what exactly is that?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: War.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No longer will you have to endure the foul taste of slaughtering the weak. No longer will you waste your efforts like a pebble hitting a rock.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I will give you a truly equal war.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Sarkaz, wandering devils.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What I will grant you... is not only the fear of your victims. I will reforge your blood, your flesh, your steel, and the shame of countless generations of your ancestors.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I will grant you slaughter, and I will grant you death.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: A new era has arrived, and war shall reign supreme.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: All Sarkaz who wish to taste all that this new era has to offer, step forward.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Who would you have us kill?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior
